findings.title: CCR - Contract Centralization Risk
findings.description: The contract's functionality and behavior are heavily dependent on external parameters or configurations, posing centralization risks such as Single Point of Control, Vulnerability to Attacks, Operational Delays, Trust Dependencies, and Decentralization Erosion.

findings.title: RSD - Redundant Swap Duplication
findings.description: The contract contains multiple swap methods that individually perform token swaps and transfer promotional amounts to specific addresses and features, introducing unnecessary complexity and increasing gas consumption.

findings.title: OCTD - Transfers Contract's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to claim all the balance of the contract by calling the `rescueETH20Tokens` or the `trackerRescueETH20Tokens` function.

findings.title: RVD - Redundant Variable Declaration
findings.description: The contract declares some variables that are not used in a meaningful way by the contract. As a result, these variables are redundant.

findings.title: PTRP - Potential Transfer Revert Propagation
findings.description: The contract sends funds to a `devWallet` as part of the transfer flow. This address can either be a wallet address or a contract. If the address belongs to a contract then it may revert from incoming payment. As a result, the error will propagate to the token’s contract and revert the transfer.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity.

findings.title: RC - Repetitive Calculations
findings.description: The contract contains methods with multiple occurrences of the same calculation being performed. The calculation is repeated without utilizing a variable to store its result, which leads to redundant code, hinders code readability, and increases gas consumption.

findings.title: MU - Modifiers Usage
findings.description: The contract is using repetitive statements on some methods to validate some preconditions instead of using modifiers which can reduce code duplication and improve readability.

findings.title: MEM - Missing Error Messages
findings.description: The contract is missing error messages in `require` statements. Error messages need to accurately reflect the problem, making it easy to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of variables without checking if their current value is the same as the one given as an argument, leading to redundant storage writes and unnecessary gas consumption.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the variable `swapTokensAtAmount` can trigger a huge amount of token swaps if set to a big number. This could lead to significant price volatility due to the highly volatile nature of the token's price.

findings.title: RED - Redundant Event Declaration
findings.description: The contract declares certain events in its code. However, these events are not emitted within the contract's functions. As a result, these declared events are redundant and serve no purpose within the contract's current implementation.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions 0.8.0 and above have native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide provides guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code, improving readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. They are often used to notify external parties or clients about events that have occurred within the contract, such as the transfer of tokens or the completion of a task.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can occur due to conditional statements that are always false, functions that are never called, or unreachable code, making a contract harder to understand and maintain, increasing its size and deployment cost.

findings.title: L11 - Unnecessary Boolean equality
findings.description: Boolean equality is unnecessary when comparing two boolean values. This is because a boolean value is either true or false, and there is no need to compare two values that are already known to be either true or false.
